results.title: Hurdle Event
results.creator_credit: Jean Roberts and Electric Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Gives coaching and training tips for hurdle events and uses slow motion footage of events from the Moscow Olympics.

results.title: High jump
results.creator_credit: Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
The techniques and steps to successful performance in the highjump event. Shows the two main principles in high jumping, illustrated with diagrams, maximising lift in practice, pointing out faults in the style of the athlete; clearing the bar by the “role” method in which the body rotates over the bar; preparatory training exercises for athletes and training procedure being practised under the direction of a coach.

results.title: The Triple jump
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”
The technique of the triple jump, sometimes known as the hop, step and jump, is shown in normal and slow motion speeds. Training and preparation techniques for achieving success in this event from the beginner stage are also shown.

results.title: The Pole vault
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
Analyses the various skills required for pole vaulting; illustrates the forces involved in run up, hang, bar clearance, and throw away from the bar. Also shows how a beginner can organize training to achieve success.

results.title: The Shot put
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
The two broad principles by which maximum velocity in object propulsion is secured are analysed and then applied to the athlete so that he can “put the shot” the greatest possible distance. Also illustrates training and preparation techniques used to condition the athlete’s body in order to get the appropriate co-ordinated muscle action. Slow motion photography is used to analyse the necessary arm, leg and body movement.

results.title: The Running broad jump
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
The technique of long jumping is shown in normal and slow motion speeds. Provides an analysis of the movements and the physical forces that are significant features of this event; shows single “hitch kick” action and outlines training programs and practices to aid the beginner.

results.title: The Hurdles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
Hurdling explained and demonstrated, aided by stop action and slow motion sequences. Includes training exercises for athletes and training procedure for both high and low hurdling being practised under the direction of a coach.
